sanskrit_verse:
प्रजनार्थं महाभागाः पूजार्हा गृहदीप्तयः ।
स्त्रियः श्रियश्च गेहेषु न विशेषोऽस्ति कश्चन ॥ ९.२६॥
transliteration:
prajanārthaṁ mahābhāgāḥ pūjārhā gṛhadīptayaḥ |
striyaḥ śriyaśca geheṣu na viśeṣo'sti kaścana || 9.26||
sph_interpretive_translation: For the purpose of procreation, O greatly fortunate ones, women who are worthy of worship and bring light to the household—there is no distinction among them based on status or form.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with Dharma, not social rank.
Causation in law is determined by functional role, not symbolic categorization.
Capacity-based responsibility applies universally without exception.
Restoration logic operates through recognition of shared essence, not external differentiation.
Consciousness alignment supersedes all artificial hierarchies.
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity contributes to Prajna-sustaining function THEN legal standing equals that of highest respect category.
IF social role supports Gruha-dipti (household illumination) THEN ceremonial equivalence is mandated.
IF biological or spiritual capacity aligns with Prajana-karana (procreative cause) THEN classification variance is nullified.
IF action serves continuation of Dharma THEN punitive distinctions do not apply.
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes a threshold where functional equivalence overrides nominal classifications. Legal standing and ceremonial honor must reflect contribution to Prajana and Griha-Dipti rather than inherited status. The court shall recognize unity of purpose as determinant over external markers.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa reveals that causality stems from alignment with Prajana-Dharma, not social labeling. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential unfoldment of roles unified in service. Responsibility flows from capacity, not caste or class. Non-punitive reality holds because all distinctions dissolve before the singular aim of sustaining life-force.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Acknowledge equal value of all procreative-supporting roles within domestic sphere.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Realign societal structures to reflect functional parity.
Capacity Restoration Mechanism: Remove barriers preventing full participation in Prajana-Dharma.
Integrity Reintegration Pathway: Normalize reverence for all forms contributing to Griha-Dipti.
final_declaration: By the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands declared: Equality in Prajana-purpose annuls all false hierarchies; Dharma prevails through consciousness-aligned unity; Justice restores integrity without recourse to punishment; Reality itself adjudicates through awakened awareness.
